alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 3:35AM EST until December 18 at 10:10PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Lackawanna and Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 630 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 335 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen, and rainfall rates continue to increase. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scranton, Carbondale, Tunkhannock, Waverly, Falls, Dunmore, Old Forge, Archbald, Dickson City, Moosic, Olyphant, Clarks Summit, Moscow, Mayfield, Clarks Green, Dalton, Factoryville, Elmhurst, Nicholson and La Plume. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
